articles.headline: Chinese Auto Parts Enter the Global Market
articles.snippet: China’s auto parts exports have increased more than sixfold in the last five years, signaling a shift from basic goods to higher-value industrial goods.
articles.abstract: China’s auto parts exports have increased more than sixfold in the last five years, signaling a shift from basic goods to higher-value industrial goods.
articles.lead_paragraph: JINZHOU, China — Zhao Qingjie’s favorite book, he says, is a Chinese translation of Lee A. Iacocca’s autobiography.

articles.headline: Independence Still the Issue at Dow Jones
articles.snippet: The Bancroft family is trying to come up with a stronger system for keeping the newsroom independent of Rupert Murdoch.
articles.abstract: The Bancroft family is trying to come up with a stronger system for keeping the newsroom independent of Rupert Murdoch.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 1981, Rupert Murdoch and a division of his News Corporation made extraordinary promises about not meddling in the news pages of The Times of London and The Sunday Times, which they were about to take over. But in short order, no one doubted who was firmly in control of the newsrooms.

articles.headline: More Fears on Inflation Hit Stocks
articles.snippet: The stock market tumbled for a second day over fears that inflation is not settling down enough to satisfy the Federal Reserve.
articles.abstract: The stock market tumbled for a second day over fears that inflation is not settling down enough to satisfy the Federal Reserve.
articles.lead_paragraph: After rising almost uninterruptedly for three months, the stock market tumbled for a second day yesterday over fears that inflation is not settling down enough to satisfy the Federal Reserve.

articles.headline: Auto Chiefs Make Headway Against a Mileage Increase
articles.snippet: Automakers seem to be making progress in tamping down Democratic proposals for tougher fuel economy requirements.
articles.abstract: Automakers seem to be making progress in tamping down Democratic proposals for tougher fuel economy requirements.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 6  Automobile companies seem to be making progress in tamping down Democratic proposals for tougher fuel economy requirements, an issue that pits powerful Democrats from Michigan against some national leaders of their own party.

articles.headline: China to Revise Rules on Food and Drug Safety
articles.snippet: It is the strongest signal yet that Beijing is moving to crack down on the sale of dangerous food and drugs.
articles.abstract: It is the strongest signal yet that Beijing is moving to crack down on the sale of dangerous food and drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, June 6  Responding to growing international concerns about tainted food and counterfeit drugs, China said late Tuesday that it was overhauling its food and drug safety regulations and would introduce nationwide inspections.

articles.headline: When Pardons Turn Political
articles.snippet: A pardon for I. Lewis Libby Jr. would attract more attention to a case from which President Bush has tried to keep his distance.
articles.abstract: A pardon for I. Lewis Libby Jr. would attract more attention to a case from which President Bush has tried to keep his distance.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 6 — President Bush has pardoned 113 people during his presidency, including a Tennessee bootlegger and a Mississippi odometer cheat.

articles.headline: Not-So-High- Definition Camcorders
articles.snippet: Two new cameras that take both still photos and high-definition video redefine “high-definition” for the worse. Another new entry is closer to the mark.
articles.abstract: Two new cameras that take both still photos and high-definition video redefine “high-definition” for the worse. Another new entry is closer to the mark.
articles.lead_paragraph: Uh-oh, it’s started. The electronics industry has begun diluting the term high-definition.
